author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Batman writer Frank Miller stops by New York Comic Con 2015
text:
dccomics ‘The Dark Knight III: The Master Race’ debuts Nov. 25. The first issue will feature both standard and variant covers, plus a series of custom retailer covers only available at select stores. The Dark Knight struck back at day two of New York Comic Con 2015.
Legendary Batman writer Frank Miller surprised the crowd at the Javits Center early Friday, celebrating the 30th anniversary of "The Dark Knight Returns" and whipping up a frenzy for the upcoming sequel.
Miller joined DC Comics artists Jim Lee, Klaus Janson, Andy Kubert and writer Brian Azzarello to reveal "The Dark Knight III: The Master Race" on the main stage.
"I couldn't be more thrilled with this team," he said, giving credit to fellow scribe Azzarello for his work on the new series, which continues the story from the 2001 DKR sequel "The Dark Knight Strikes Again."
The 58-year-old admitted that he would love the opportunity to direct a live action movie based on his original story. His previous directorial experience includes "The Spirit" and co-directing the "Sin City" movies with Robert Rodriguez.
Sean Keane/ New York Daily Newsm From left, moderator John Cunningham, Jim Lee, Klaus Janson, Andy Kubert and Brian Azzarello welcome surprise guest Frank Miller to the main stage at the New York Comic Con Friday.
He also compared Batman to a diamond, noting that "he won't break," despite more than 75 years of evolution and changing political climates.
"Batman is wonderfully malleable, you can throw him into any situation and you can't hurt him."
Each issue of "The Dark Knight III" will come with a second comic book inside, telling a parallel story focusing on various DC characters. The first part, drawn by Miller and inked by Janson, will feature The Atom.
The original "Dark Knight Returns" featured an iconic battle between Batman and Superman that had clear influence on "Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice," which arrives in theaters March 25, 2016.
The first issue of "The Dark Knight III: The Master Race" hits shelves in mid-November.
